TopicTitle: [1.0.5] Adjustable Landing Gear v1.2.0 (mass/cost scaling, tech nodes, drag) - May 30

Articles.Content: Really great work as always. Thank you for this awesome landing gear.

from what I'm seeing, can we only get the gear to bend in a positive direction at the top and negative at the bottom and vice versa? I wanted some side deploying landing gear, but it's looking like that isn't possible as flip inverts both of these axes.
Give me a picture if what you have in mind, and I'll see if it's possible
@BahamutoD Sounds like the landing gear from nli2work's RetroFuture pack. Gear itself would be facing 90 degrees from point of origin. I.E. Belly-mounted gear like on the P-51. Photo of Landing Gear

Also, the Dream Chaser's rear gear fold in sideways that way. I'd love to see this too.

Edited November 13, 2014 by Alshain
Looks awsome downloading.
Any idea why the wheel bay doors aren't closing? Everything else works great, but the doors stay open after the wheels fold up.

Suspension spring and Suspension damper values - what the number means ?

High number is softer or stiffer spring ? For damper does high number means that spring will oscilate more or less ?

Seeing as this is all about planes... flying at alt of around 13000/14000 my pilot disappears and I lose control of the plane. I don't want to derail this thread, so could someone direct me to where this problem is being discussed? I've searched all over but cant find anything about it.

By-the-way, this mod is great, I love it!
Looks great, wheels where always a problem in stock and even in B9. Adding this to my "can't play without".

@BlackGlass Sand, for a aircraft building guide I suggest to start with Basic Aircraft Design thread. Also check last post, I have made picture to better explain my design goals, provided with full craft files in different thread. Link is available in that post.

@kcs123, Well done thread, but my plane design is fine. It's the pilot in lower right that simply disappears at higher alt. The plane stays intact and simply drifts down as if the pilot bailed out.

So as to not derail, I'll post a new topic in support. Sorry OP, I should have done that to start with.

@BahamutoD small request. could you add KSP-AVC support? its very simple, and makes keeping one's overflowing GameData folder up to date without having to scavenge these forums, as much fun as that is to do. Absolutely love your mod, wouldn't ask otherwise

@BahamutoD small request. could you add KSP-AVC support? its very simple, and makes keeping one's overflowing GameData folder up to date without having to scavenge these forums, as much fun as that is to do. Absolutely love your mod, wouldn't ask otherwise

You may also find it helpful to make an account at KerbalStuff and "follow" all of the mods hosted there. Between that, KSP-AVC, and subscribing to dev and release threads on this forum, I'm pretty confident about staying on top of mod updates. (I've also made a Github account and have considered hunting down and following all of the mod repos hosted there, but haven't felt the need to go that far yet.)

Give me a picture if what you have in mind, and I'll see if it's possible

This is what I had in mind. Of course it's kind of tight with the angles to actually do this (25+60 <= 90) but even placing them slightly down the sides of the would be neat. Or just add another 5 degrees too.

How do you install this? I took the bolded folder and put that in the gamedata folder of ksp ad it doesn't work. Adjustable_Landing_Gear-1.0.3 2/GameData/BahaSP

also i have your lightning cockpit installed and it's also called bahasp so i renamed the one for the gears as adjustable gears but still no go.

I have no doubt that these will one day become stock parts. Wonderful wonderful job. These are preciely what is missing from stock along with a few other obvious things but the current selection of landing gear is just unacceptable. You sir get an A+

http://i.imgur.com/ZeQFgxA.png

This is what I had in mind. Of course it's kind of tight with the angles to actually do this (25+60 <= 90) but even placing them slightly down the sides of the would be neat. Or just add another 5 degrees too.

Thanks, that's what I thought. I'll see.

How do you install this? I took the bolded folder and put that in the gamedata folder of ksp ad it doesn't work. Adjustable_Landing_Gear-1.0.3 2/GameData/BahaSP

also i have your lightning cockpit installed and it's also called bahasp so i renamed the one for the gears as adjustable gears but still no go.

Never rename folders when installing mods. You should merge the two BahaSP folders. You also need Firespitter.dll as stated, which should be in GameData/Firespitter/Plugins/

Thanks, that's what I thought. I'll see.

Never rename folders when installing mods. You should merge the two BahaSP folders. You also need Firespitter.dll as stated, which should be in GameData/Firespitter/Plugins/
